page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT IN MILLAND
page.content: there is no major employment in the block in fact the majority of the working population travel outside the area to work-many to the i.c.i. experimental station at fernhurst. in the miland valley frming is still the predominant occupation, although concentrated farming like broiler house chicken and turkeys need a minimum of manpower. garages, small shops and public houses employ local people, and there is plenty of scope for jobbing gardeners and household help. there is an increase in the number of self-employed contractors, small builders, electricians and plumbers. other sources of jobs are the schools,stocklands riding school,forest mere health farm, and in a small way the pottery & furniture workshop,milland forest crafts and forestry and gamekeeping.
